statements.name: PROC JSON
statements.description: Specifies the JSON output file and controls the resulting output.

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: identifies the JSON output file.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: specifies the SAS fileref that is assigned to the JSON output file. To assign a fileref, use the FILENAME statement.

arguments.name: "external-file"
arguments.description: is the physical location of the JSON output file. Include the complete pathname and the filename. Enclose the physical name in single or double quotation marks. The maximum length is 200 characters.

arguments.name: FMTCHARACTER
arguments.description: applies a character SAS format to the resulting output if a character SAS format is associated with a SAS data set variable.

arguments.name: FMTDATETIME
arguments.description: applies a date, time, or datetime SAS format to the resulting output if a date, time, or datetime SAS format is associated with a SAS data set variable.

arguments.name: FMTNUMERIC
arguments.description: determines whether to apply a numeric SAS format to the resulting output if a numeric SAS format is associated with a SAS data set variable.

arguments.name: KEYS
arguments.description: determines whether exported observations are written as JSON objects or as JSON arrays.

arguments.name: NOFMTCHARACTER
arguments.description: does not apply a character SAS format to the resulting output if a character SAS format is associated with a SAS data set variable.

arguments.name: NOFMTDATETIME
arguments.description: does not apply a date, time, or datetime SAS format to the resulting output if a date, time, or datetime SAS format is associated with a SAS data set variable.

arguments.name: NOFMTNUMERIC
arguments.description: does not apply a numeric SAS format to the resulting output if a numeric SAS format is associated with a SAS data set variable.

arguments.name: NOKEYS
arguments.description: determines whether exported observations are written as JSON objects or as JSON arrays.

arguments.name: NOPRETTY
arguments.description: determines how to format the JSON output.

arguments.name: NOSASTAGS
arguments.description: suppresses SAS metadata when using the EXPORT statement.

arguments.name: NOSCAN
arguments.description: determines whether PROC JSON scans and encodes input strings to ensure that only characters that are acceptable are exported to the JSON output file.

arguments.name: NOTRIMBLANKS
arguments.description: determines whether to remove or retain trailing blanks from the end of character data in the JSON output.

arguments.name: PRETTY
arguments.description: determines how to format the JSON output.

arguments.name: SASTAGS
arguments.description: includes SAS metadata when using the EXPORT statement.

arguments.name: SCAN
arguments.description: determines whether PROC JSON scans and encodes input strings to ensure that only characters that are acceptable are exported to the JSON output file.

arguments.name: TRIMBLANKS
arguments.description: determines whether to remove or retain trailing blanks from the end of character data in the JSON output.

statements.name: EXPORT
statements.description: Identifies the SAS data set to be exported and controls the resulting output.

arguments.name: libref
arguments.description: identifies the SAS data set to be exported with either a one- or two-level SAS name (library and member name). If you specify a one-level name, by default, the JSON procedure uses either the User library (if assigned) or the Work library.

arguments.name: (SAS-data-set-options)
arguments.description: specifies SAS data set options that apply to the input SAS data set.

arguments.name: FMTCHARACTER
arguments.description: applies a character SAS format to the resulting output if a character SAS format is associated with a SAS data set variable.

arguments.name: FMTDATETIME
arguments.description: applies a date, time, or datetime SAS format to the resulting output if a date, time, or datetime SAS format is associated with a SAS data set variable.

arguments.name: FMTNUMERIC
arguments.description: applies a numeric SAS format to the resulting output if a numeric SAS format is associated with a SAS data set variable.

arguments.name: KEYS
arguments.description: determines whether exported observations are written as JSON objects or as JSON arrays.

arguments.name: NOFMTCHARACTER
arguments.description: does not apply a character SAS format to the resulting output if a character SAS format is associated with a SAS data set variable.

arguments.name: NOFMTDATETIME
arguments.description: does not apply a date, time, or datetime SAS format to the resulting output if a date, time, or datetime SAS format is associated with a SAS data set variable.

arguments.name: NOFMTNUMERIC
arguments.description: does not apply a numeric SAS format to the resulting output if a numeric SAS format is associated with a SAS data set variable.

arguments.name: NOKEYS
arguments.description: determines whether exported observations are written as JSON objects or as JSON arrays.

arguments.name: NOSASTAGS
arguments.description: suppresses SAS metadata when using the EXPORT statement.

arguments.name: NOSCAN
arguments.description: indicates that the input string is known to contain acceptable JSON text or has already been scanned. When NOSCAN is in effect, the input string or character value is taken as is, and the output JSON string is enclosed in quotation marks.

arguments.name: NOTRIMBLANKS
arguments.description: retains trailing blanks from the end of character data in the JSON output.

arguments.name: SASTAGS
arguments.description: includes SAS metadata when using the EXPORT statement.

arguments.name: SCAN
arguments.description: PROC JSON scans and encodes input strings to ensure that only characters that are acceptable are exported to the JSON output.

arguments.name: TABLENAME=
arguments.description: specifies a name for the exported SAS data set.

arguments.name: TRIMBLANKS
arguments.description: removes trailing blanks from the end of character data in the JSON output.

statements.name: WRITE VALUES
statements.description: Writes one or more values to the JSON output file.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: specifies one or more values to write to the JSON output file. Separate values with a blank space.

arguments.name: SCAN
arguments.description: determines whether PROC JSON scans and encodes input strings to ensure that only characters that are acceptable are exported to the JSON output.

arguments.name: NOSCAN
arguments.description: determines whether PROC JSON scans and encodes input strings to ensure that only characters that are acceptable are exported to the JSON output.

arguments.name: TRIMBLANKS
arguments.description: determines whether to remove or retain trailing blanks from the end of character data in the JSON output.

arguments.name: NOTRIMBLANKS
arguments.description: determines whether to remove or retain trailing blanks from the end of character data in the JSON output.

statements.name: WRITE OPEN
statements.description: Opens and nests a JSON container in the output file.

arguments.name: ARRAY
arguments.description: specifies that the JSON container is an array, which collects a list of values.

arguments.name: OBJECT
arguments.description: specifies that the JSON container is an object, which collects key-value pairs.

statements.name: WRITE CLOSE
statements.description: Closes a JSON container that is open in the JSON output file.
